Package com.jgaap.distances

Class Summary
CamberraDistance Camberra distance, defined as D(x,y) = sum (| (xi -yi)/(xi + yi) |).
CamberraDistanceTest  
CosineDistance Cosine Distance or normalized dot product.
CosineDistanceTest  
CrossEntropyDivergence Cross-entropy "divergence" for Nearest Neighbor.
CrossEntropyDivergenceTest  
DistanceTestHelper  
HistogramDistance Histogram distance using L2 metric,(defined as D(x,y) = sum ((xi -yi)^2) This is YA distance for Nearest Neighbor algorithms
HistogramDistanceTest  
IntersectionDistance Given two event type-sets, A,B, calculate 1 - ||A intereset B|| // ||A union B||
IntersectionDistanceTest  
KendallCorrelationDistance KendallCorrelationDistance : sequence-based distance for NN algorithm suggested by (Wilson & Martinez 1997, JAIR).
KendallCorrelationDistanceTest  
KeseljWeightedDistance Histogram distance as weighted by Keselj (2003).
KeseljWeightedDistanceTest  
KullbackLeiblerDivergence Kullback-Leibler divergence, to be treated as YA distance for nearest-neighbor algorithms.
KullbackLeiblerDivergenceTest  
LevenshteinDistance LevenshteinDistance, the edit-distance between two sequences of Events.
LevenshteinDistanceTest  
LZWDistanceTest  
LZWDivergence LZWDistance, : conditional LZW distance, basically LZW(ab)-LZW(b).
ManhattanDistance Histogram distance using L1 metric,(defined as D(x,y) = sum (|xi -yi|).
ManhattanDistanceTest  
MeanDistance Mean Distance or normalized dot product.
MeanDistanceTest  
NominalKSDistance Nominal Kolmogorov-Smirnov distance for Nearest Neighbor algorithm
NominalKSDistanceTest  
Xent2
